newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to post $290 mln August trade gap - report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to post $290 mln August trade gap - report.

text.p: The Brazilian government is expected to report an August trade deficit of around $290 million, the newspaper O Globo reported on Thursday.
This would bring the trade deficit for the year to date to $920 million, O Globo said.
Brazilian exports in August amounted to around $4.6 billion, while imports were around $4.9 billion, O Globo said.
The newspaper said Finance Minister Pedro Malan was trying to calm financial markets even before the official release of the trade figures, due later today.
"The export sector does not worry us in the least," O Globo quoted Malan as saying. "It makes no difference if the trade balance records a deficit one month."
He said imports were on the rise because the country was investing to modernize and increase productivity, according to O Globo.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro Newsroom 5521 507 4151
